DataElement.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Variance Reason Code ISO21090.DSET.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed study level administrative activity that is independent of a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): IRB Approval, site enrollment, FDA audit A coded value specifying why what occurred is different from what was expected. EXAMPLE(S): Subject received early treatment because of vacation plans.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Variance Reason Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection containing unordered distinct/discrete values of the type CD.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
